reviews: As a retired (70s) person I needed a phone for Calling, Messaging, Entertainment, Browsing and Chrome casting. This phone is OK. But the weight of the phone gives pain in my fingers. Using Jio Router for WiFi. Although phone has dual band Wi-Fi capability, 2.4GHZ only gave a speed of 22 while 5GHZ gave full 30mbps. My old Realme phone only single band gives full 30 at the same spot. But overall it is still value for money for hard pressed oldies like me. On 22nd July, after 3 days of purchase I was pleased to receive MIUI 14 which is Android 13. Tested all features of Android 13 and so far no problems.I am writing again after 3 days of using MIUI 14 ie Android 13. Suddenly after 2 days my apps are behaving strangely. Calculator has no numeric pad, Battery Icon doesn't show %, drop down Status bar tray is showing only few icons. Immediately took it to MI service centre and new software was installed in 45 mts. and phone seems to work well with Android 13. Keeping fingers crossed. I have now visited MI Service Centre 3 times since my device was purchased on 19th July and still crashing. I hope MI will take up the matter seriously and not do a shoddy warranty job. I have not at all used the phone even for a single day.

Here is my honest review of the Redmi 12C smartphone:Pros:Good performance - The MediaTek Helio G85 processor and 4GB RAM provide smooth performance for day-to-day tasks and light gaming.Large display - It has a 6.71-inch HD+ display which is nice for watching videos and gaming. The teardrop notch is unobtrusive.Excellent battery life - With a large 5000mAh battery, the 12C can easily last 1.5-2 days of use on a single charge. Standby time is fantastic.Decent cameras - The 13MP rear and 5MP front cameras capture decent shots in good lighting conditions. The AI camera features are nice to have.Affordable price - Starting at just Rs. 8,999, the 12C offers good value considering the large display, battery and performance.Cons:Dated design - The thick bezels and plastic body make it look outdated compared to competitors. Build quality could be better.Average low-light photography - The cameras struggle in low light situations with visible noise. No ultra-wide or macro lens.Only 18W charging - Charging the large 5000mAh battery is slow with the included 18W charger. No support for faster charging.HD display - The display has only HD+ resolution (1600 x 720 pixels) resulting in less sharpness compared to Full HD displays.Overall, the Redmi 12C is a decent affordable smartphone for basic use and light gaming. It excels in battery life but has an outdated design and average camera performance. For the price, it's a good option for budget buyers who prioritize battery life and core performance. But those wanting better design or cameras can consider other options.

Camera does have 50 megapixel but you will get only portrait, normal, night, HDR and time lapse modes. I think night mode can be better.It is quite easy to use and is quite a sturdy one.It doesn't heat much but it can if you play high quality games which requires more functions like PUBG.Charging comes with normal one, there is no c type port and it takes its time to charge, no supercharge function.Appearance wise it's one of the best, you get great colour options and purple looks really good.I think this is a good budget phone.

Good built quality and appearance.Dislikes -many basic features that are only software related are also dropped for no reason.No new control center.Camera app don't have panorama, slow motion, document, AI modes. They are all software related not hardware which doesn't cost anything.Same way gallery editor is restricted of many common features like auto adjust image, colour focus filters etc.Auto brightness has some difficulty in adjustment.No live wallpaper,no always on display.Home screen grid is limited to only 4x4 and 5x5 in such a big screen. It should be atleast upto 5X7 option.No option to pin window or floating window, or split screen app option from recent menu.Hardware side -IR blaster, gyroscope sensor for compass, proximity sensor are missing for cost cutting.Type C charging port also dropped which is unbelievable.Extreme thick bazels and big lower space is just increased the size of phone.The weight is more than expected and size is also very big (even bigger than my redmi note 10 pro). God knows the reason behind making such bulky oversize phones. You cannot find any smaller size phone in the market.Screen quality, sound quality, camera quality are acceptable at this price range. No issue faced.Fingerprint sensor is at very high position, difficult to reach, and frequently you will touch camera lens instead of FP sensor because of the placement.Conclusion:On overall, it's basically a good hardware side purchase at this price range with very basic features (especially for elders and family members. But again too bulky for elders).On software side complete disappointment from MIUI for removing very basic features from its applications for no good reason.

I recently had the chance to explore the Redmi 12C in Matte Black, and my experience has been a combination of both positive and not-so-positive aspects. Here's a detailed breakdown:Pros:High-Performance Processor: The inclusion of the Mediatek Helio G85 processor brings a noticeable boost in performance, ensuring smoother multitasking and responsiveness.Excellent Battery Life: The battery life on the Redmi 12C is certainly a standout feature. It holds up impressively even during extended use, reducing the need for frequent charges.Cons:Display Performance: While the display is good overall, it falls short of being exceptional. Colors and clarity are satisfactory, but I expected a bit more vibrancy and sharpness.Sound Quality: Unfortunately, the sound quality did not meet my expectations. The audio output lacks the depth and richness I anticipated, which can impact the overall multimedia experience.MIUI OS: The MIUI operating system brings its own set of challenges. The user experience could be smoother, and certain functionalities, such as the contact search not showing recently added contacts and a delay in recent call history list updates, have been noticeable issues.Camera Performance: The camera's performance is average, offering acceptable results but not quite meeting the high standards set by other devices in this category.The Redmi 12C brings a mix of features to the table, with some aspects that shine and others that leave room for improvement. The high-performance processor and remarkable battery life are commendable, providing an enhanced user experience. However, areas like display vibrancy, sound quality, and the MIUI OS experience could use further refinement. While the camera captures moments adequately, it doesn't deliver exceptional results. For those seeking a budget-friendly option with a balance of strengths and weaknesses, the Redmi 12C could be considered. Keep in mind the trade-offs and decide based on your priorities.

I recently had the opportunity to use the latest smartphone model, and I must say that my experience was a mixed bag. While it does have some noteworthy features, there are several areas where improvements are needed.Starting with the positives, the battery backup of this device is commendable. It offers an impressive lifespan, allowing me to use it throughout the day without constantly worrying about running out of power. This is definitely a strong advantage for users who heavily rely on their smartphones for various tasks.However, I encountered a few drawbacks that significantly impacted my overall satisfaction. Firstly, the back panels of the device produce an unpleasant noise when held, which can be quite irritating and diminishes the overall quality of the phone. Additionally, the display did not meet my expectations. The visual quality and clarity fell short, resulting in a subpar viewing experience. This is an important aspect of any smartphone, and I was disappointed by the underwhelming display performance.Furthermore, the camera capabilities of the device were average at best. While it managed to capture decent photos in well-lit environments, it struggled in low-light situations, resulting in grainy and lackluster images. Considering the significance of smartphone photography in today's world, this is an area that could definitely benefit from improvement.Another frustrating aspect was the network connectivity issues. There were instances where the phone failed to establish a stable internet connection, necessitating a restart. This inconvenience disrupted my workflow and hindered my ability to access online content seamlessly. Additionally, I found the GPS to be unreliable, with frequent calibration problems and poor detection accuracy. This was particularly frustrating when relying on navigation apps or location-based services.

There is nothing I dislike about this phone. Only my expectations were too high after watching the several youtuber's reviews. Nothing special about this phone either. Hence the 3 star rating.I upgraded to this phone from a four year old Realme 3 (4/64 GB). But my old phone still beats this one in terms of speed. The 4000 mAH battery of Realme 3 gave me the same backup 4 years ago which this 6000 mAH in this phone gives me now.The phone comes with lots of bloatware. You can uninstall many of the useless apps. But there still remain many samsung apps which I don't use and I cannot uninstall. Samsung pay cannot store your credit card information. Only UPI and your IDs etc can be kept there. If you want to use credit card in any online transaction, you will still have to take the plastic card out of your pocket to punch in the details if you do not memorize it.The more weight and thickness of this phone are the only cons for me. But the promise of 4 years of software updates and robust service network nullify these cons.Overall, an average phone..

I have purchased this phone for my mother, this is her first smart phone so i thought i should go for a simple smartphone with clean ui with a large battery. So bought this. Now let's talk about the pros and consPros:1. Large screen: the screen is really big and colours are bright.2. Large battery: 5000 mah battery is really useful, my mother doesn't use the phone too much so it's last for 2 to 3 days with minimal usage.3. Android go : it has the Android 13 go edition so it's light version that's why it's working smooth.4. Dual rear camera does it's job but the front camera is really impressive.5.Dialer: It has Xiaomi dialer so you can record call without announcement.Cons :1. No type C port so we have to carry an extra cable as all of our phone has type C port.2. Long Charging time: no fast charging provided so it's taking longer time to charge the battery.3. No widget options ( till now August 2023) so you can't add weather or clock or contact widget on the home screen.4. No double tap to screen on/off feature ( till now Aug 2023).5. It's taking time to load videos or the settings options on 2gb variant, i mean if i open YouTube it's taking 4 to 5 second to load the videos on YouTube ( I'm using the device on WiFi so no network issue, it's happening for the weak processor). I have installed WhatsApp from play store, nothing else installed on the phone but still it's taking some times for some app loading. But it's okay it's not a issue for someone who just started using smartphone.Also you can uninstall or disable maximum of preloaded apps. I have uninstalled maximum of those apps. Also I have disabled the Chrome browser, as my mother didn't search any thing on internet. I have disabled the browser so even if my mother clicked on any link on YouTube or on another apps it doesn't work so kind of safe for my mother also.So i just want to say this phone is just for calling, WhatsApp, for normal YouTube videos & music. Also i think if you are getting the 2GB variant under 6k then it's a good deal. Don't pay more for this even if you are buying 4gb 64gb it will not change much on the performance.Thank you.Edit 1 : Even after getting 3 software updates they didn't include the widgets option as well as the double tap function. So i think this option will not available in future also, may be this features are not for Android go editions. So keep that in mind, although my mother never complaint about the clok as she check the time from the notification bar or from the lock screen.

After using it for a month, I can state , the Redmi A2 (Classic Black, 4GB RAM, 64GB Storage) is an excellent budget smartphone that delivers impressive features and performance. From its vibrant display to its capable cameras and long-lasting battery, it offers a well-rounded experience for the price. If you are looking for a reliable and affordable smartphone, I highly recommend considering the Redmi A2.Pros:1. Great value for money: The Redmi A2 offers an impressive range of features and performance at an affordable price point.2. Vibrant display: The 6.52-inch IPS LCD screen delivers sharp and clear visuals, making it enjoyable for multimedia consumption.3. Smooth performance: The Mediatek Helio G36 chipset, coupled with the octa-core processor and 4GB RAM, ensures smooth multitasking and lag-free performance.4. Expandable storage: The device comes with 64GB of internal storage, which can be further expanded using the dedicated microSDXC card slot, providing ample space for your files and apps.5. Decent camera performance: The dual rear cameras capture satisfactory photos with good detail and color accuracy, and the addition of features like dual-LED flash and HDR enhances the camera's capabilities.6. Long-lasting battery: The 5000mAh non-removable battery offers excellent battery life, allowing for a full day of usage without worrying about running out of power.7. User-friendly interface: The Redmi A2 runs on Android 13 (Go edition) with MIUI, providing a user-friendly interface and a range of customization options.8. Sleek design: The device boasts a sleek and slim design, with the Classic Black color variant adding an elegant touch.9. Added benefit is warranty - 2 years [1 year + extra 1 year (special introductory offer)]Cons:1. Moderate display resolution: While the display is vibrant, the 720 x 1600 pixel resolution may not offer the highest level of sharpness compared to higher-end devices.2. Modest camera setup: The camera setup on the Redmi A2 is modest, which may not satisfy users who require advanced camera capabilities.3. Limited charging speed: The device supports 10W wired charging, which is not as fast as some other smartphones in the market.Please be aware that these benefits and drawbacks are based on individual usage and may change based on preferences and usage patterns.

Before saying anything about A2, I would like to mention properly that is a below ‚Çπ7,000 smartphone. In this slab of pricing, Xiaomi has packed a USB charger, decent battery which goes on from 13-15 hours in good use (non gaming, movie etc) in single charge.Camera is good, not exceptional.The OS feels like Stock Android. As Classic MIUI Apps seemed missing by me like notes, compass, IR Remote.Does not support 5GHz Wifi. Works smooth on 2.4Ghz Wifi.The built qualify is simply AWESOME. Feel in hand is Awesome.Brithness is pretty good, touch and response time is very smooth and fast. Bootup time is pretty fast too.Comes with a dedicated SD Card slot along with dual sim slots (total 3 slots in tray).In box they have packed the phone, charger, USB type A-B cable. (No tempered glass or back cover), No fingerprint or face unlock - REMEMBER THE PRICE.Final conclusion: the phone is good in this price range specially the smoothness, built quality, screen size, clean Android OS with majority Google's Apps like Google One, Google Gallery etc. Yes some small small things are missing but that is fine because the price is also kept pretty low. The Phone is good for those who have average use of smartphones or if you want to make this as a secondary business need smartphone. Or simply a phone for a school student.I recommend this product untill and unless Redmi asks you to pay more than ‚Çπ7500.

Firstly, the design of the phone is sleek and modern, with a slim profile that makes it easy to hold and carry around. The 6.5-inch FHD+ display is crystal clear and provides a great viewing experience for watching videos or playing games.The performance of the Redmi 10 Power is exceptional, thanks to the 8GB RAM and the powerful Snapdragon 662 processor. The phone runs smoothly and seamlessly, and I have not experienced any lag or slowdown even when multitasking or running resource-intensive apps.The battery life of the Redmi 10 Power is simply outstanding. With a massive 6000mAh battery, I can easily go through an entire day of heavy usage without needing to recharge. And when I do need to charge the phone, the 18W fast charger included in the box quickly charges the battery back up.The camera on this phone is also impressive, with a 48MP quad-camera setup that captures stunning photos and videos. The AI scene recognition and night mode features are particularly noteworthy, as they allow me to take great photos in low-light conditions.Overall, I would highly recommend the Redmi 10 Power to anyone looking for a powerful, feature-packed smartphone at an affordable price. It is an excellent value for money, and I am extremely satisfied with my purchase

I recently had the opportunity to use the latest smartphone model, and I must say that my experience was a mixed bag. While it does have some noteworthy features, there are several areas where improvements are needed.Starting with the positives, the battery backup of this device is commendable. It offers an impressive lifespan, allowing me to use it throughout the day without constantly worrying about running out of power. This is definitely a strong advantage for users who heavily rely on their smartphones for various tasks.However, I encountered a few drawbacks that significantly impacted my overall satisfaction. Firstly, the back panels of the device produce an unpleasant noise when held, which can be quite irritating and diminishes the overall quality of the phone. Additionally, the display did not meet my expectations. The visual quality and clarity fell short, resulting in a subpar viewing experience. This is an important aspect of any smartphone, and I was disappointed by the underwhelming display performance.Furthermore, the camera capabilities of the device were average at best. While it managed to capture decent photos in well-lit environments, it struggled in low-light situations, resulting in grainy and lackluster images. Considering the significance of smartphone photography in today's world, this is an area that could definitely benefit from improvement.Another frustrating aspect was the network connectivity issues. There were instances where the phone failed to establish a stable internet connection, necessitating a restart. This inconvenience disrupted my workflow and hindered my ability to access online content seamlessly. Additionally, I found the GPS to be unreliable, with frequent calibration problems and poor detection accuracy. This was particularly frustrating when relying on navigation apps or location-based services.

The Samsung M04 offers a budget-friendly option with a 6.2-inch display, providing a decent viewing experience for its price point. Its performance is satisfactory for everyday tasks thanks to the Snapdragon processor and 3GB of RAM, though demanding apps or games might not run as smoothly.The camera setup, featuring a dual-lens rear camera with a 13MP main sensor and a 2MP depth sensor, captures acceptable photos in well-lit conditions, but struggles in low light. The front-facing 5MP camera is suitable for basic selfies and video calls.The device houses a 5,000mAh battery, which can easily last through a day of regular usage. However, charging is done through a micro-USB port, which might be a bit outdated for some users.On the software side, the M04 runs Samsung's One UI on top of Android, providing a user-friendly experience and some customization options. As for storage, the 32GB internal storage can be expanded via microSD card for those who need more space.In summary, the Samsung M04 is a decent budget smartphone that gets the basics done, but it's important to manage expectations given its limitations in terms of performance and camera quality, which are common trade-offs in this price range.

The Samsung Galaxy M04 is an affordable smartphone that offers decent performance and good battery life . However, it lacks some features such as gyroscope sensitivity and a macro camera üì∑.If you are looking for a budget-friendly phone that can handle basic tasks like calling, texting, and browsing the internet, the Samsung Galaxy M04 is a good choice. It runs on Android 12 and is powered by a 5000mAh batteryüîã.The phone has a 13-megapixel primary camera on the rear and a 5-megapixel front camera for selfies . The Samsung Galaxy M04 in Light Green may be budget-friendly, but it falls disappointingly short when it comes to camera performance. If you're someone who enjoys capturing life's moments with stunning clarity, this phone is bound to leave you feeling frustrated.Camera Performance:The 13MP primary camera on the Galaxy M04 struggles to produce satisfactory results, especially in anything less than optimal lighting conditions. Photos taken indoors or in low-light environments suffer from excessive noise and lack of detail. Even in well-lit settings, the colors appear muted, and the dynamic range is limited. The 5MP front camera is equally lackluster, producing selfies that lack sharpness and clarity. If you're a photography enthusiast, this phone simply won't meet your expectations.Gaming Performance:While the Galaxy M04 manages day-to-day tasks adequately, it's not designed for high-performance gaming. Graphically demanding games often suffer from lag and frame rate drops, making the gaming experience less enjoyable. If you're into heavy mobile gaming, you'd be better off considering a more powerful device.Battery Life:Although the 5,000mAh battery is impressive on paper, the subpar gaming performance drains the battery quickly during extended gaming sessions. While the phone may suffice for parents who use it for occasional tasks, the battery life may not last a full day under heavy usage scenarios.Display:The 6.3-inch HD+ LCD display is mediocre at best. While it gets the job done for casual media consumption, the lack of vibrant colors and average viewing angles fail to impress. The visual experience simply doesn't match up to other smartphones in this price range.Software and Updates:Samsung's One UI skin is generally user-friendly, but the budget nature of this phone means that major updates and feature enhancements might not be promptly delivered. This could lead to missing out on essential improvements and security patches.Conclusion:If you're a photography enthusiast or a heavy mobile gamer, the Samsung Galaxy M04 Light Green will be a major disappointment. The lackluster camera performance, subpar gaming capabilities, and average display make it unsuitable for users who prioritize these aspects. However, if you're a parent or a casual user who primarily needs a phone for basic tasks like calls, messaging, and light browsing, the Galaxy M04 might suffice. For anything more demanding, there are better options available in the market at a similar price point.Pros:Suitable for parents or casual users with basic needsAffordable price pointCons:Subpar camera performance in various lighting conditionsNot suitable for high-performance gamingMediocre display qualityPotential delays in major software updatesRating: 2.5/5

I recently purchased the Samsung Galaxy M04 in the eye-catching Light Green color variant, and I must say I am quite impressed with what this budget-friendly smartphone has to offer. At a price of just 7499, it delivers a compelling combination of features that cater to the needs of everyday users.Performance-wise, the Samsung Galaxy M04 is equipped with a MediaTek Helio P35 Octa-core processor, which handles day-to-day tasks and applications smoothly. The 4GB of RAM ensures multitasking is manageable, but what's interesting is the RAM Plus feature that allows users to utilize up to 8GB of RAM, providing extra headroom for demanding apps and games.With 64GB of onboard storage, there's ample space to store your favorite apps, photos, videos, and more. In case you need additional storage, the phone also supports expandable storage via a microSD card.The highlight of the Samsung Galaxy M04 is undoubtedly its long-lasting 5000mAh battery. For regular users, this battery capacity easily lasts a full day on a single charge, reducing the need to carry a charger around constantly. It's a relief to know that this phone won't leave you stranded with a dead battery when you need it the most.Moving on to the camera capabilities, the Galaxy M04 sports a 13MP dual-camera setup, which captures decent photos in good lighting conditions. While it might not produce the same quality images as high-end flagship devices, it certainly suffices for social media sharing and general photography needs. The camera app offers some useful features like portrait mode and various filters to enhance your photography experience.In terms of design, the Light Green color variant is refreshing and stands out from the usual black or white smartphones in the market. The phone's build quality feels solid, and the ergonomic design makes it comfortable to hold for extended periods.On the software front, the Samsung Galaxy M04 runs on the company's One UI, which is known for its user-friendly interface and customizability. With the latest Android version pre-installed, you can expect a smooth and familiar user experience.However, it's important to note that this phone might not be the best choice for heavy mobile gamers or those seeking cutting-edge performance, as it is more tailored for casual users with everyday needs.In conclusion, the Samsung Galaxy M04 Light Green edition is an excellent option for anyone looking for a reliable and affordable smartphone. With its striking design, impressive battery life, and the option to expand RAM, it offers great value for money at a price point of 7499. Whether you are a student, a professional, or someone who just needs a dependable device for day-to-day tasks, the Galaxy M04 won't disappoint.

I have purchased this phone for my mother, this is her first smart phone so i thought i should go for a simple smartphone with clean ui with a large battery. So bought this. Now let's talk about the pros and consPros:1. Large screen: the screen is really big and colours are bright.2. Large battery: 5000 mah battery is really useful, my mother doesn't use the phone too much so it's last for 2 to 3 days with minimal usage.3. Android go : it has the Android 13 go edition so it's light version that's why it's working smooth.4. Dual rear camera does it's job but the front camera is really impressive.5.Dialer: It has Xiaomi dialer so you can record call without announcement.Cons :1. No type C port so we have to carry an extra cable as all of our phone has type C port.2. Long Charging time: no fast charging provided so it's taking longer time to charge the battery.3. No widget options ( till now August 2023) so you can't add weather or clock or contact widget on the home screen.4. No double tap to screen on/off feature ( till now Aug 2023).5. It's taking time to load videos or the settings options on 2gb variant, i mean if i open YouTube it's taking 4 to 5 second to load the videos on YouTube ( I'm using the device on WiFi so no network issue, it's happening for the weak processor). I have installed WhatsApp from play store, nothing else installed on the phone but still it's taking some times for some app loading. But it's okay it's not a issue for someone who just started using smartphone.Also you can uninstall or disable maximum of preloaded apps. I have uninstalled maximum of those apps. Also I have disabled the Chrome browser, as my mother didn't search any thing on internet. I have disabled the browser so even if my mother clicked on any link on YouTube or on another apps it doesn't work so kind of safe for my mother also.So i just want to say this phone is just for calling, WhatsApp, for normal YouTube videos & music. Also i think if you are getting the 2GB variant under 6k then it's a good deal. Don't pay more for this even if you are buying 4gb 64gb it will not change much on the performance.Thank you.Edit 1 : Even after getting 3 software updates they didn't include the widgets option as well as the double tap function. So i think this option will not available in future also, may be this features are not for Android go editions. So keep that in mind, although my mother never complaint about the clok as she check the time from the notification bar or from the lock screen.

After using it for a month, I can state , the Redmi A2 (Classic Black, 4GB RAM, 64GB Storage) is an excellent budget smartphone that delivers impressive features and performance. From its vibrant display to its capable cameras and long-lasting battery, it offers a well-rounded experience for the price. If you are looking for a reliable and affordable smartphone, I highly recommend considering the Redmi A2.Pros:1. Great value for money: The Redmi A2 offers an impressive range of features and performance at an affordable price point.2. Vibrant display: The 6.52-inch IPS LCD screen delivers sharp and clear visuals, making it enjoyable for multimedia consumption.3. Smooth performance: The Mediatek Helio G36 chipset, coupled with the octa-core processor and 4GB RAM, ensures smooth multitasking and lag-free performance.4. Expandable storage: The device comes with 64GB of internal storage, which can be further expanded using the dedicated microSDXC card slot, providing ample space for your files and apps.5. Decent camera performance: The dual rear cameras capture satisfactory photos with good detail and color accuracy, and the addition of features like dual-LED flash and HDR enhances the camera's capabilities.6. Long-lasting battery: The 5000mAh non-removable battery offers excellent battery life, allowing for a full day of usage without worrying about running out of power.7. User-friendly interface: The Redmi A2 runs on Android 13 (Go edition) with MIUI, providing a user-friendly interface and a range of customization options.8. Sleek design: The device boasts a sleek and slim design, with the Classic Black color variant adding an elegant touch.9. Added benefit is warranty - 2 years [1 year + extra 1 year (special introductory offer)]Cons:1. Moderate display resolution: While the display is vibrant, the 720 x 1600 pixel resolution may not offer the highest level of sharpness compared to higher-end devices.2. Modest camera setup: The camera setup on the Redmi A2 is modest, which may not satisfy users who require advanced camera capabilities.3. Limited charging speed: The device supports 10W wired charging, which is not as fast as some other smartphones in the market.Please be aware that these benefits and drawbacks are based on individual usage and may change based on preferences and usage patterns.

The Samsung M04 offers a budget-friendly option with a 6.2-inch display, providing a decent viewing experience for its price point. Its performance is satisfactory for everyday tasks thanks to the Snapdragon processor and 3GB of RAM, though demanding apps or games might not run as smoothly.The camera setup, featuring a dual-lens rear camera with a 13MP main sensor and a 2MP depth sensor, captures acceptable photos in well-lit conditions, but struggles in low light. The front-facing 5MP camera is suitable for basic selfies and video calls.The device houses a 5,000mAh battery, which can easily last through a day of regular usage. However, charging is done through a micro-USB port, which might be a bit outdated for some users.On the software side, the M04 runs Samsung's One UI on top of Android, providing a user-friendly experience and some customization options. As for storage, the 32GB internal storage can be expanded via microSD card for those who need more space.In summary, the Samsung M04 is a decent budget smartphone that gets the basics done, but it's important to manage expectations given its limitations in terms of performance and camera quality, which are common trade-offs in this price range.

The Samsung Galaxy M04 is an affordable smartphone that offers decent performance and good battery life . However, it lacks some features such as gyroscope sensitivity and a macro camera üì∑.If you are looking for a budget-friendly phone that can handle basic tasks like calling, texting, and browsing the internet, the Samsung Galaxy M04 is a good choice. It has a large 6.5-inch touchscreen display with a resolution of 720x1600 pixels . The phone is powered by a MediaTek Helio P35 processor and comes with 4GB of RAM . It runs on Android 12 and is powered by a 5000mAh batteryüîã.The phone has a 13-megapixel primary camera on the rear and a 5-megapixel front camera for selfies . It also has a microSD card slot that allows you to expand the storage up to 1TB .üôÇ

The Samsung Galaxy M04 in Light Green may be budget-friendly, but it falls disappointingly short when it comes to camera performance. If you're someone who enjoys capturing life's moments with stunning clarity, this phone is bound to leave you feeling frustrated.Camera Performance:The 13MP primary camera on the Galaxy M04 struggles to produce satisfactory results, especially in anything less than optimal lighting conditions. Photos taken indoors or in low-light environments suffer from excessive noise and lack of detail. Even in well-lit settings, the colors appear muted, and the dynamic range is limited. The 5MP front camera is equally lackluster, producing selfies that lack sharpness and clarity. If you're a photography enthusiast, this phone simply won't meet your expectations.Gaming Performance:While the Galaxy M04 manages day-to-day tasks adequately, it's not designed for high-performance gaming. Graphically demanding games often suffer from lag and frame rate drops, making the gaming experience less enjoyable. If you're into heavy mobile gaming, you'd be better off considering a more powerful device.Battery Life:Although the 5,000mAh battery is impressive on paper, the subpar gaming performance drains the battery quickly during extended gaming sessions. While the phone may suffice for parents who use it for occasional tasks, the battery life may not last a full day under heavy usage scenarios.Display:The 6.3-inch HD+ LCD display is mediocre at best. While it gets the job done for casual media consumption, the lack of vibrant colors and average viewing angles fail to impress. The visual experience simply doesn't match up to other smartphones in this price range.Software and Updates:Samsung's One UI skin is generally user-friendly, but the budget nature of this phone means that major updates and feature enhancements might not be promptly delivered. This could lead to missing out on essential improvements and security patches.Conclusion:If you're a photography enthusiast or a heavy mobile gamer, the Samsung Galaxy M04 Light Green will be a major disappointment. The lackluster camera performance, subpar gaming capabilities, and average display make it unsuitable for users who prioritize these aspects. However, if you're a parent or a casual user who primarily needs a phone for basic tasks like calls, messaging, and light browsing, the Galaxy M04 might suffice. For anything more demanding, there are better options available in the market at a similar price point.Pros:Suitable for parents or casual users with basic needsAffordable price pointCons:Subpar camera performance in various lighting conditionsNot suitable for high-performance gamingMediocre display qualityPotential delays in major software updatesRating: 2.5/5

I recently purchased the Samsung Galaxy M04 in the eye-catching Light Green color variant, and I must say I am quite impressed with what this budget-friendly smartphone has to offer. At a price of just 7499, it delivers a compelling combination of features that cater to the needs of everyday users.Performance-wise, the Samsung Galaxy M04 is equipped with a MediaTek Helio P35 Octa-core processor, which handles day-to-day tasks and applications smoothly. The 4GB of RAM ensures multitasking is manageable, but what's interesting is the RAM Plus feature that allows users to utilize up to 8GB of RAM, providing extra headroom for demanding apps and games.With 64GB of onboard storage, there's ample space to store your favorite apps, photos, videos, and more. In case you need additional storage, the phone also supports expandable storage via a microSD card.The highlight of the Samsung Galaxy M04 is undoubtedly its long-lasting 5000mAh battery. For regular users, this battery capacity easily lasts a full day on a single charge, reducing the need to carry a charger around constantly. It's a relief to know that this phone won't leave you stranded with a dead battery when you need it the most.Moving on to the camera capabilities, the Galaxy M04 sports a 13MP dual-camera setup, which captures decent photos in good lighting conditions. While it might not produce the same quality images as high-end flagship devices, it certainly suffices for social media sharing and general photography needs. The camera app offers some useful features like portrait mode and various filters to enhance your photography experience.In terms of design, the Light Green color variant is refreshing and stands out from the usual black or white smartphones in the market. The phone's build quality feels solid, and the ergonomic design makes it comfortable to hold for extended periods.On the software front, the Samsung Galaxy M04 runs on the company's One UI, which is known for its user-friendly interface and customizability. With the latest Android version pre-installed, you can expect a smooth and familiar user experience.However, it's important to note that this phone might not be the best choice for heavy mobile gamers or those seeking cutting-edge performance, as it is more tailored for casual users with everyday needs.In conclusion, the Samsung Galaxy M04 Light Green edition is an excellent option for anyone looking for a reliable and affordable smartphone. With its striking design, impressive battery life, and the option to expand RAM, it offers great value for money at a price point of 7499. Whether you are a student, a professional, or someone who just needs a dependable device for day-to-day tasks, the Galaxy M04 won't disappoint.

About the phoneApple phone without a second delay, I would say it is better than all android phones I have used. The phone is like water, it flows in a way you want and shaping in your way. In a best way possible, the phone is designed to only show what the user wants and eliminating unnecessary ads, features that I have seen in android.Why it is better than Android?You pay too much money for Apple products, obviously you experience the features, physical components , camera lens etc. Apart from basic things, you can also enjoy the best applications available in app store. If you are a developer you might know the app store policy for application publish and their security posture towards handling payment apps etc. They publish best application and the way the apps, its modules switches is just flawless. Due to the so called strict policy of privacy program with Apple products, iPhone can pop up a box in your screen if any apps wants to track your activity with other applications. +1 respect for apple to show such concern with user.Apple phones are same ? like 13 vs 14The reason 14 is same as 13 may be business practice followed from 11th edition. But please note that iPhone making changes internally like physical components (small change in battery performance, lens in 14 edition), additional features but that may not satisfy you to buy 14 edition. If you do not find "the very few changes" interesting in 14, go for 13. Because physical and even cameras are not visually very much different in 13 vs 14 comparison. Also you get 13 for cheap :)14 is just added features but that is not for daily use, the features real time use is rare case. But the best part is there is no extra cost between 13 vs 14 prices (except extra 10k slash)Concern you must have.Apple is not giving chargers and their silicon cases are very expensive (but very good in touch and scratch friendly in back due to silk layer). This is an issue for sure. You have to buy charger not coming with USB C and claiming that you help carbon footprint, understandable but not customer friendly business model. Even after the purchase I had to spend at least 7k for charger and case.Apple care.I am not buying it, I pay for phone which is already expensive for this premium and apple care does have strict policy that if you understand that is waste. Instead I find a private insurance to make things better.

It is just a review from my side so that its good for you to know before buying rather than regretting later.Positives:* Showoff* Camera* Sound* Security (they say, bt that blocks so many accessibility options for me)* So many awesome features as all iphone users say (which probably I will use once in a lifetime)Negatives for me (You may like it):1. No shortcut to change between vibration and no vibration frequently.2. No end call button on the lock screen.3. Call list is nonsense. It shows phone, whatsap and all other calls in same list.4. Go to a specific contact in call history n you can see only history of one day. Total length of call history is 100. Most probably you will not be able to find call history of previous week for a specific contact.5. Need of Itunes to copy music from PC to phone.6. No file manager like android where we can see and access complete folder structure.7. No silent and vibrate mode notification on screen.8. Need to buy separate adapter n earphones after already spending double.9. Cannot remove torch icon in iphone14 from lock screen. You may end up switching it on unwillingly.10. BT and WiFi shortcuts will just disconnect them. To turn off you need to go to Settings screen and turn it off again.11. In so many places, either text or files, there is no Select All option. (I'm waiting for android users to get all pics received in whatsapp after a trip).12. Takes a lot of time to get detected by devices when hotspot is on.13. At some screen you get stuck and you will miss the back button.14. Copy some mp3 files to your iphone and you will never be able to find it with default music app.15. Every app will be either on lot of home screens or organised under some groups. You will never get a clean home screen with 2 or 3 most frequently used apps and all other apps in a swipe up menu like android.16. No fingerprint sensor.Adding to the list after using for 2 months:17. Cannot turn off camera shutter sound in general mode.18. No option to flag contact as spam/scam.19. If you connect wireless BT device, it won't show battery percentage of BT device.20. You get a notification while using phone and you miss to open it, then you will not see it until you remember yourself to open notification screen. Notification icons won't be pinned on top of the screen like Android.21. If you use 2 SIM and want to switch mobile data between SIMs, there is no shortcut than going to Settings screen. Also, cannot see current amount of data used or left.List goes on and on, try it yourself.. No iphone owner speaks about limitations. Some people like iphone for these and others hate it for these. If you can pay double and handle these adjustments with work arounds, go ahead. Once you unlock and give your phone to someone, or once you give access permissions to apps, even iphone is not most secure. Fr example, If you are driving and someone wants to use your phone for music/maps etc., then you have to give your password, because there is no fingerprint option and face recogniton feature will become dangerous option.

The Apple iPhone 14 is overall a great phone for anyone who is looking for high speed, excellent camera quality, and a day-long of battery life. The squared-off sides are more comfortable to hold in your hand in my opinion. I purchased this one and so far my experience has been wonderful. Something I like about this phone is its fast speed along with the different options the camera gives you. I wouldn't say the iPhone 14 has a better camera than the 13, rather I think they are more similar and there wasn't a dramatic improvement. The battery life is something that I wish was a little longer. It last about an hour or two more than the average iPhone 13, but does charge faster. I have been able to receive about a 50% charge in 30 minutes. Another great feature of this phone is the painless eSIM setup. Being able to set up the SIM card virtually and not a physical transfer on your phone makes carrying over carriers from phone to phone much easier. battery lasts as long as the iPhone 13. As you may remember, it was much better than the iPhone 12. The iPhone 14 is a smooth, responsive phone and great for high-quality gaming or photo and video editing. Overall I think this is a great phone to purchase if you are looking for a durable and sustainable upgrade and I do think it is worth the extra hundred dollars from the 13.

I have purchased this phone for my mother, this is her first smart phone so i thought i should go for a simple smartphone with clean ui with a large battery. So bought this. Now let's talk about the pros and consPros:1. Large screen: the screen is really big and colours are bright.2. Large battery: 5000 mah battery is really useful, my mother doesn't use the phone too much so it's last for 2 to 3 days with minimal usage.3. Android go : it has the Android 13 go edition so it's light version that's why it's working smooth.4. Dual rear camera does it's job but the front camera is really impressive.5.Dialer: It has Xiaomi dialer so you can record call without announcement.Cons :1. No type C port so we have to carry an extra cable as all of our phone has type C port.2. Long Charging time: no fast charging provided so it's taking longer time to charge the battery.3. No widget options ( till now August 2023) so you can't add weather or clock or contact widget on the home screen.4. No double tap to screen on/off feature ( till now Aug 2023).5. It's taking time to load videos or the settings options on 2gb variant, i mean if i open YouTube it's taking 4 to 5 second to load the videos on YouTube ( I'm using the device on WiFi so no network issue, it's happening for the weak processor). I have installed WhatsApp from play store, nothing else installed on the phone but still it's taking some times for some app loading. But it's okay it's not a issue for someone who just started using smartphone.Also you can uninstall or disable maximum of preloaded apps. I have uninstalled maximum of those apps. Also I have disabled the Chrome browser, as my mother didn't search any thing on internet. I have disabled the browser so even if my mother clicked on any link on YouTube or on another apps it doesn't work so kind of safe for my mother also.So i just want to say this phone is just for calling, WhatsApp, for normal YouTube videos & music. Also i think if you are getting the 2GB variant under 6k then it's a good deal. Don't pay more for this even if you are buying 4gb 64gb it will not change much on the performance.Thank you.Edit 1 : Even after getting 3 software updates they didn't include the widgets option as well as the double tap function. So i think this option will not available in future also, may be this features are not for Android go editions. So keep that in mind, although my mother never complaint about the clok as she check the time from the notification bar or from the lock screen.

After using it for a month, I can state , the Redmi A2 (Classic Black, 4GB RAM, 64GB Storage) is an excellent budget smartphone that delivers impressive features and performance. From its vibrant display to its capable cameras and long-lasting battery, it offers a well-rounded experience for the price. If you are looking for a reliable and affordable smartphone, I highly recommend considering the Redmi A2.Pros:1. Great value for money: The Redmi A2 offers an impressive range of features and performance at an affordable price point.2. Vibrant display: The 6.52-inch IPS LCD screen delivers sharp and clear visuals, making it enjoyable for multimedia consumption.3. Smooth performance: The Mediatek Helio G36 chipset, coupled with the octa-core processor and 4GB RAM, ensures smooth multitasking and lag-free performance.4. Expandable storage: The device comes with 64GB of internal storage, which can be further expanded using the dedicated microSDXC card slot, providing ample space for your files and apps.5. Decent camera performance: The dual rear cameras capture satisfactory photos with good detail and color accuracy, and the addition of features like dual-LED flash and HDR enhances the camera's capabilities.6. Long-lasting battery: The 5000mAh non-removable battery offers excellent battery life, allowing for a full day of usage without worrying about running out of power.7. User-friendly interface: The Redmi A2 runs on Android 13 (Go edition) with MIUI, providing a user-friendly interface and a range of customization options.8. Sleek design: The device boasts a sleek and slim design, with the Classic Black color variant adding an elegant touch.9. Added benefit is warranty - 2 years [1 year + extra 1 year (special introductory offer)]Cons:1. Moderate display resolution: While the display is vibrant, the 720 x 1600 pixel resolution may not offer the highest level of sharpness compared to higher-end devices.2. Modest camera setup: The camera setup on the Redmi A2 is modest, which may not satisfy users who require advanced camera capabilities.3. Limited charging speed: The device supports 10W wired charging, which is not as fast as some other smartphones in the market.Please be aware that these benefits and drawbacks are based on individual usage and may change based on preferences and usage patterns.

Nice mobile in this price range I get it for only 5.4k it's an good price1 camera: camera üì∏ quality is very nice for camera 5/52 gaming : in this price range it comes with an good processor no lag on small games like temple run , Subway surfers ect 4/53 display: the display quality is also good at this price range 4/54 battery: battery will last upto more than 8 hrs on simple use like browsing , YouTube,calls ,camera 4/55 charging time: it comes with 10w changer it takes more than 4 hrs to Full change 4/5Overall score is 4/5

Before saying anything about A2, I would like to mention properly that is a below ‚Çπ7,000 smartphone. In this slab of pricing, Xiaomi has packed a USB charger, decent battery which goes on from 13-15 hours in good use (non gaming, movie etc) in single charge.Camera is good, not exceptional.The OS feels like Stock Android. As Classic MIUI Apps seemed missing by me like notes, compass, IR Remote.Does not support 5GHz Wifi. Works smooth on 2.4Ghz Wifi.The built qualify is simply AWESOME. Feel in hand is Awesome.Brithness is pretty good, touch and response time is very smooth and fast. Bootup time is pretty fast too.Comes with a dedicated SD Card slot along with dual sim slots (total 3 slots in tray).In box they have packed the phone, charger, USB type A-B cable. (No tempered glass or back cover), No fingerprint or face unlock - REMEMBER THE PRICE.Final conclusion: the phone is good in this price range specially the smoothness, built quality, screen size, clean Android OS with majority Google's Apps like Google One, Google Gallery etc. Yes some small small things are missing but that is fine because the price is also kept pretty low. The Phone is good for those who have average use of smartphones or if you want to make this as a secondary business need smartphone. Or simply a phone for a school student.I recommend this product untill and unless Redmi asks you to pay more than ‚Çπ7500.

Nokia C12 ek acha budget fone hai, middle-class Indian ke liye perfect hai. TL:DR:1) If you are on a really tight budget, you can go for this phone.2) The HiOS is very bloated, buggy, laggy OS. Eventhough this is based on Android 12, using this phone feels like a using a prehistoric, old OS3) If you can spend 1k~2k more, go for other manufacturers.4) TECNO should ditch their HiOS and stick to Pure android OS if they want to see success in the Indian market. The OS is destroying the performance of the phone which has really good H/W specs for this price point.PRO's:1) 4GB/6GB RAM and 64GB/128GB storage.2) Decent Processor and Graphics for entry level gaming3) Large Display4) Front Single and Rear Dual FlashCON's:1) For a full charge from 0% to 100%, it will take 3 to 3.5 Hours2) The HiOS is very bloated, buggy, laggy OS. Eventhough this is based on Android 12, using this phone feels like a using a prehistoric, old OS3) Lots and Lots of junk apps that cannot be removed. Palm Store is the worst of the lot, It keeps sending notifications even when the app is disabled.4) The battery life suffers because of the bloated operating system and the unwanted applications that are running in the background.5) Lack of battery optimization features in HiOS6) Doubtful if this device will receive future Android OS updates in the future (13/14) as TECNO has not mentioned anything about this on their website.7) Camera is not upto the mark and do not expect great pictures.8) The S/W based RAM extension is useless as the 64GB/128GB ROM is slow and using this as the extended RAM is equivalent to using the Mechanical HDD as the extended RAM on Desktop computers.
TECNO SPARK MOBILE

Update on Earphones: I received (via Delhivery courier) my earphones within 2 weeks of scanning the QR code and following the instructions on the box and the site. Make sure that you fill in the CORRECT and COMPLETE details as they will check/VERIFY the same. I am happy that Nokia India kept their promise. (Only suggestion was that Nokia could have provided me an option to choose the colour of my earphones).******************A week since I received the phone ... and this is my personal opinion for my Nokia G21 (6/128). I already have a heavy duty mobile and chose the G21 as a secondary phone for routine work (not for gaming or photo/videography)Pros:- Feels comfortable in the hand, just the right weight for me.- Battery charge appears to last longer.- No unnecessary apps. All Google stock apps - some which can be uninstalled (the only 3rd party app Netflix can be uninstalled as well)- Camera is decent. Has 6x digital zoom for photos and 3x for videos.- Has 2 nano SIM slots and a separate slot for the SD card.- In the box, you get a protective plastic back case, pin, charger and cable.- Charging is via USB C port (which I feel is better).- Has call recording feature (via Google phone app). Also has screen recorder with 3 audio options (microphone/device/combo) - nice !- Amazon shipment was fast !Neutral:- Sound quality is good. Only 1 speaker - Nokia could have made this a dual speaker and upped the sound. (The sound level drops by a notch when the screen recorder is used but only with the combo audio option)- The 3.5mm audio headphone port is on the top of the phone.Cons:- Fingerprint Scanner/Reader: While the scanner is very responsive, there is an irritating mechanism where the scanner locks itself automatically for 30 seconds if it reads an unidentified print (3 times). This may look good from a security point of view but any touch of skin and the scanner goes mad. I got fed up and removed the fingerprint option - Nokia should provide a software update to let the user choose if the scanner lock option should be automatic or not (and even the 30 sec is an excess - let the user define the parameter).(Noticed that one of the apps closed off on its own but worked fine later on - could be an one-off glitch - if it persists, I will update the review)Giving it 4 stars (removing a star for the fingerprint scanner).

This is for the 6GB/128GB/Nordic Blue variant.I have had this device for about a week now and overall happy with the purchase. Here are some of the pros and cons -Pros: Stock android (no bloatware), Great battery life (lasted a good 2 days easily with moderate use - video calls, youtube, browsing), crystal clear audio, no lags, shipping time was pretty good.Cons: No 5G (not sure if this is really a con, but lack of this may not make this device future proof). One day the phone froze when I tried to browse. I did not expect this to happen with 6GB RAM and stock android, but this could be because of the processor. I restarted the device and did not have this issue since (Could have been a software bug that cleared after a restart since it is fairly new). I know there are reviews here that complain about this, but it is a gadget after all and may have some teething issues. Need to give it some time, dont jump to conclusions right away. Hardware seems to be pretty good even with the Unisoc processor, so any other issue could be software related and could be fixed with updates or following some simple steps.Other features that dont matter much to me - Dual SIM (tested and working good), camera is not up to the mark but I did not buy this for the camera (I could care less about this feature, but Nokia should definitely improve on this).Every device has reviews that complain about something or the other. To me, Nokia is still a good trusted brand that sticks to basics and keeps everything simple (without the bells and whistles of other flagships, features of which are mostly useless but we end up paying a lot more for those unnecessary features and bloatware).Since the phone was used only for a week, cant really say much (hence rated it a 4, might change it after using for a month or so). This was bought for someone that needed good battery life, clear voice and WhatsApp calls and this perfectly fit the bill.Note: You also get free earpods with this, but they dont come in the box. You have to raise a request on Nokia after purchase and writing a review on Amazon. I am yet to claim that which should make this deal more sweeter (since I already got Rs. 750 off of the offer price of Rs. 14,999 when I purchased it).

Update 30/12/2022:So, nokia advertised an offer on the box of this model's 6GB variant, to leave a review on amazon and get free earbuds. Six months later, they have had zero communication, let alone sending the free earbuds.The review below still stands irrespective of this, but I am taking off 3 stars, for shady and misleading practices.First of all it boggles me to see that the market is just swamped with the chinese phone brands, more than I can count on my fingers. As I never intend to buy any such brand, the options were limited. Nokia has been pushing out some good products recently, and since back in the 'nokia is king' years, a decade ago, I owned many handsets, 2300, 6600, N95, 5230 etc., there certainly was a nostalgic factor.The main things I like about this is1. Clean UI, minimal OEM customizations.2. Minimal bloatware, there were 2-3 apps installed as part of the first time setup process, but these can be quickly uninstalled.3. Guest mode, this might not be relevant to most users, but it is important if one wants to compartmentalize some of their activities/usage on phone, by signing up as another user(s). This feature was lacking (to my amazement) in some of other brands' flagships.4. Battery seems to be lasting well, a good 2 days or more with light usage (no gaming but web surfing, calls, chatting, videos etc.).Cons:1. Repairability: Not so much a con (unless you break your screen), but I think in terms of repairability, this phone is a moderate to high level. The phone accidentally fell hard, and the screen broke within the first month itself. Since over the years, I have self-repaired a couple of broken phone screen myself I decided to repair this too. The replacement screen costed 3000 rs. The disassembly went just fine, except two snags - 1) the battery has some really strong sticky tabs, so much that there is a high likelihood of bending the battery slab while taking it out, and 2) the screen is glued to the frame, instead of being bolted with screws, which makes the frame prone to scratching during repair.2. Teardrop screen: never liked these 'aberrations' of notch, punch hole or teardrop screens. Should have had a clean no-notch screen.Overall, I think going by the market price segment this phone is in, you may not be getting your 'bang for buck'. But for me, trust in a brand has always been highly important. That is why I have never bought a chinese brand. What is ironic, is that the old Nokia, HTC and LG, the clean players (for the most part) closed their shops. :-)Think about if you can really trust your phone. I hope the answer is in the affirmative. If not, this might be a good choice.

Here are my thoughts on the phone written below.It‚Äôs a good as a second phone but there are some things to be desired.The good-The battery life is good, not the claimed 3 days but then it depends on the user. It more than survives over a day of heavy usage so that‚Äôs a plus. The screen is decent, not 1080p but it does have 90 hertz refresh rate which is very impressive in this price bracket. The screen does a good job with content, being a 720p display. The phone feels snappy in most cases but that‚Äôs mostly due to the combination of the display and the processor, don‚Äôt expect the apps to open instantaneously but it‚Äôs fast enough that it doesn‚Äôt feel laggy. Cameras are decent, not too good or too bad, don‚Äôt expect much from it. Stock android is sublime, there‚Äôs no bloatware whatsoever.The bad-The phone looks very generic and like every other budget phone, although I like the display overall; I do particularly wish it was 1080p. Phone feels laggy with some apps in the background and app switching simply relaunches the app a little slower than it initially launched, RAM is the issue there, 4gb is simply not enough but it makes sense in terms of the price. One thing I really don‚Äôt like is the camera UI, it‚Äôs super laggy and switching between camera modes is long enough that you feel yourself growing old. It‚Äôs abysmal, i hope it can be fixed with a software update. Processor clearly shows it‚Äôs shortcomings in situations like these.Thoughts-Overall the G21 is a great buy as a second phone if you don‚Äôt wanna splurge on a secondary device. Do not expect any thing great in terms of performance but if you wanna buy this simply as a phone with some light content watching and your usual social media consumption, it‚Äôs great. My nitpickings are from as a power user, but it‚Äôs wrong of me to expect too much from a budget-midrange phone. It‚Äôs a good back up phone for anyone looking to buy one!Cheersüçª

As soon as I bought this phone, I realised there were a few functions missing. I thought the problems will be corrected in subsequent updates, but now at least than a year I have already forgotten what basic functions I wanted. Then at around 6 months time, the front camera stopped working and I thought maybe it was my mistake or my daughter may have changed some settings that I am not able to reverse. Now it is less than a year from buying this phone and the battery has swollen and my phone is switching off within an hour almost. I went to the authorised repair for Nokia (by the way, there are only 3 such authorised dealers in Pune, which has become the biggest city in Maharashtra now). I went there and there was nobody at the reception desk to talk to a customer. After waiting 15 minutes I called "koi hai?" and one person attended me. I asked him to check if there was a problem with my charger or the battery and he said it will be Rs 350 only to check. I asked why? He said they will need to call for a spare battery. I, being a woman with no technical knowledge, told him that he could check if the battery was swollen or he could plug the phone to another charger to check if the phone was recharging any faster and that he need not take 3 days to just check where the problem lies and no need to spend 350 either. He became silent at this answer. Then he said I will need to leave the phone with him for at least a day for him to check it and that I will need to fill a form. I said "nobody asked me to fill a form when buying the phone, and you need a whole day just to see if the battery is swollen or the charger has a problem?" Even govt departments have started working faster than them. That same morning I had gone to a govt department and got resolution within 2 hours. And yet, I thought 2 hours wait was too long. And here, a pvt company's customer service is taking a while day just to see if the battery is swollen?? I don't have a trained eye and 2 days after, even I can tell that the battery is swollen.Question is, why did the battery die within a year? Even duplicate batteries work longer than that.

I am thrilled to write a glowing review for the Nokia G21 series phone! As a proud user of this device for the past year, I can confidently say that it has exceeded my expectations in every way.First and foremost, the durability of this phone is unmatched. Despite using it for a year, I have not faced a single issue or malfunction. The phone's build quality is top-notch, and it can withstand the wear and tear of daily use with ease.In terms of performance, the Nokia G21 is a powerhouse. Its smooth handling and lightning-fast processing speed make it a joy to use. Whether I'm browsing the internet, streaming videos, or playing games, this phone can handle everything with ease.But the Nokia G21 is not just functional; it is also a beautiful device. The phone's sleek and elegant design is eye-catching and feels great in my hand. The screen is crystal-clear and provides an immersive viewing experience that is second to none.Overall, I highly recommend the Nokia G21 series phone to anyone who is looking for a reliable, high-performance device. Its durability, speed, and stunning design make it one of the best phones on the market, and I am proud to have it in my pocket every day!

I am impressed by the Nokia series of phones; I got this one for my dad and so far he has been extremely satisfied with the phone. The device feels and looks sturdy and despite the low price compared to other brands, it is pretty responsive and does not display any lag. Plus, the absence of any manufacturer's own bloatware makes it a very "light" phone to use, and not confusing the elders like him. I am not very gung ho about its camera though, and hence I have not gone ahead and given 5 stars. And its not like my dad is into professional photography so not an issue at all. In a nutshell, I am impressed by the Nokia series, given the features and its price point and I have gone ahead and got the C21 Plus for my teenager two days back. I am definitely recommending it for users looking for a budget friendly mobile device.

I have been a big Nokia fan though Symbian OS had its fair share of limitations. With the side thumb print unlock very accessible and also easy to identify with its lower placement, it is easy to lock and unlock the phone quicklyThe screen is a delight to view and though the tear drop design is dated it is less intrusive to the viewing angles than the iphone notch or the pill on other phonesThe battery life is stupendous. This review illustrates the pros and cons of the device from the perspective of a casual mobile user who does not want to spend much on devices and still craves a nice and seamless experience for day-to-day life. This phone I bought before the Amazon GIF 2022 was not our first choice but after getting it we are so pleased as it meets all the criteria.Aesthetics (7/10): In this price segment this phone looks quite great and elegant with a minimalistic design.Processing works (8/10): With 4 GB ram and a Mali-G57 MP1 processor, it runs smoothly. So far, no lag has been witnessed and apps stay in the background without closing.The call quality (8/10): The calling and answering are also great as the sound of the caller can be heard with clarity.Battery (8/10): With moderate to heavy usage i.e., watching videos all day long it requires charging once a day. With the Li-Po 5050 mAh, the battery does not heat up and is also not during running apps and multitasking.Display (7/10): The best quality is the display of the phone; it is not a typical IPS, unlike other devices in this range it gives a way better viewing experience and the elements are sharp. 90Hz display is enjoyable and 400nits is enough for any use unless one is a photographer or gamer.Android (10/10): Extremely satisfied with the android one experience. Way smoother than expected as the device has only 4 GB of ram.Camera (7/10): Although it provides a sufficiently good camera, the images are not so great (you will not find any great camera in this price range in any other Chinese brands). In daylight, it is able to take decent pictures with enough details.Resolution (6/10): Once getting used to it for 2 to 3 days no one would notice the significant difference between 720x1200 and higher. But nowadays full HD has become a minimum requirement.In conclusion, I am fully satisfied with the purchase given the price I have paid for it.

I presented this phone to my Father in-law and mother in-law recently. They were never familiar with Android phone and had been using the old nokia handsets forever. Initially they were a bit hesitant to use it but as we started teaching them, they found the simplicity of this model and were soon excited to use them! It's been a week since they have been using the Nokia G21 and they're really happy with it. The audio quality of the phone is excellent. They are super excited about the camera since they never clicked photos of their own. My father in-law watches cricket on YouTube and the wide screen of the phone does justice to his cricket cravings. The UI of the phone is user friendly, security measures are on power and the 50MP camera helps my mom in-law take amazing photos of her beautiful garden! Over all it's been a great purchase!

UPDATE: Received Android 13 update in April and every thing works without any issue.UPDATE: Received android 12 update in December and after that everything is running smooth.I am writing a this review after two and a half days of use. The device was delivered within 3 days after I placed my order. I will be writing this review based on my personal experience and will write about the things that I like and I don't about this device.Things that I liked:i) I really like the battery life. When I recieved the phone it was charged around 50 percent so, I plugged it in and charged to 100%. After that I haven't charged the phone yet, and after two and a half days of medium to heavy uses which includes a few hours of gaming and a few more of streaming on Youtube and Netflix, I still have 34% left right now. This is a big upgrade for me.ii) Camera quality is decent for a phone of this range, It wouldn't come close to a Professional camera, but is more than enough for your everyday selfies and some light amateur photography.iii)The phone comes with a cover, so no worrying about scratches in the first few days of uses.iv)The screen is very responsive and will handle your day to day online gaming without any issues.Suggestionsi) The screen is a little too large a slightly smaller screen would have been much better.ii) The power adapter is only 10 watts. My older Nokia 7.1 came with a 17 watts charger and since this phone ships with a larger battery capacity, the power adapter should be a little more powerful.This my opinion based on my use case. I would definetly suggest this phone for those who need a powerful battery and do medium to heavy gaming.Also I have clicked some pictures which I am attaching with this review.

The Nokia G21 mobile phone is an excellent device that offers a wide range of impressive features. One of its most outstanding features is the massive 6.5-inch display screen that delivers clear and sharp images. Additionally, its 5000mAh battery capacity ensures you never run out of power, allowing you to enjoy uninterrupted gaming, music streaming, and social media browsing. Furthermore, its 3GB RAM and 32GB internal storage are capable of running multiple applications without any lags.The Nokia G21's camera is another aspect that impresses me. With its 13MP main camera, 5MP ultra-wide, and 2MP depth sensor, taking stunning pictures and videos have never been easier. The phone's night mode also enables you to capture clear and crisp images even in low-light conditions.Overall, the Nokia G21 is an excellent device that offers exceptional value for money. With its stunning display, long battery life, and powerful camera, it is worth every penny invested in it, making it a perfect choice for anyone looking for a reliable yet affordable smartphone.

Phone is ok for general usage, but my struggles with Nokia continue. The place where I live has no proper mobile reception, I'm heavily dependent on Vo Wifi calling. i had absolutely no issues with my previous Samsung phone, but Nokia G21 frequently disconnects in the middle of a call. I tried reaching out to customer service but was not helpful.Advertisements are promising but I don't find it living up to it . Camera is not great either. Promise of 2year updates is another disappointment. There is Android 13 available and my G21 still runs on Android 11. At this rate, they can promise 4 years of updates also but it does not help customers.I always knew Nokia is bit expensive at this range compared to others. Only because my affinity towards Nokia I still bought this one, though I didn't have a great experience with Nokia 6 either. Nokia has got the advertisements right, but it is high time they start delivering those promises.

First of all it boggles me to see that the market is just swamped with the chinese phone brands, more than I can count on my fingers. Clean UI, minimal OEM customizations.2. Minimal bloatware, there were 2-3 apps installed as part of the first time setup process, but these can be quickly uninstalled.3. Guest mode, this might not be relevant to most users, but it is important if one wants to compartmentalize some of their activities/usage on phone, by signing up as another user(s). This feature was lacking (to my amazement) in some of other brands' flagships.4. Battery seems to be lasting well, a good 2 days or more with light usage (no gaming but web surfing, calls, chatting,But for me, trust in a brand has always been highly important. That is why I have never bought a chinese brand. What is ironic, is that the old Nokia, HTC and LG, the clean players (for the most part) closed their shops. :-)Think about if you can really trust your phone. I hope the answer is in the affirmative. If not, this might be a good choice.

I recently purchased the Realme Narzo 50i Prime in Dark Blue with 4GB RAM and 64GB Storage. While it has its strengths, it also falls short in some key areas.Pros:1. **Affordable Price**: The Realme Narzo 50i Prime is a budget-friendly phone, making it accessible for those looking for an affordable smartphone.2. **Decent Battery Life**: The 5000 mAh battery is one of the phone's standout features. It provides a good amount of juice to last through a day of moderate use.3. **Smooth Performance**: The octa-core processor handles everyday tasks and apps reasonably well, ensuring smooth operation for the most part.Cons:1. **Display Quality**: The display leaves much to be desired. Colors appear washed out, and the resolution is not sharp. It's a significant drawback, especially for media consumption.2. **Camera Performance**: The camera setup on this phone is rather basic. While it can capture decent photos in well-lit conditions, low-light photography is disappointing, and there's a noticeable lack of detail in images.3. **Limited RAM**: With only 4GB of RAM, the phone struggles with multitasking, and apps tend to reload frequently. This can be frustrating for users who like to switch between apps quickly.4. **Bloatware**: The Realme Narzo 50i Prime comes with a fair amount of pre-installed bloatware, which can be annoying. You'll need to spend some time uninstalling or disabling unnecessary apps.5. **Build Quality**: The phone feels a bit plasticky and not as sturdy as some of its competitors in the same price range.Overall, the Realme Narzo 50i Prime is an okay budget phone. If you're on a tight budget and prioritize battery life and basic functionality over display quality and camera performance, it might be worth considering. However, if you can stretch your budget a bit, there are better options available in the market that offer a more well-rounded smartphone experience.
